metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3077 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel Intelâ€™s iSMT SMBus host controller driver in the way it handled the I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_PROC_CALL case (via the ioctl I2C_SMBUS) with malicious input data. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
